page.title: 03Transport: aircraft
page.content: {Aeroplanes} fly in the air carrying people and goods around the world. The biggest passenger plane is the {Jumbo Jet,} the fastest is {Concorde} which travels at twice the speed of sound. A captain is in control and must get permission to take off or land at the airport. Most large aircraft need a runway several miles long for take off and landing. The plane can fly on autopilot once it has taken off. A steward or stewardess looks after the passengers and brings their meals. Special aviation fuel is used for these jet aircraft and {Concorde} carries 26,000 gallons, enough to fly 4,400 miles. Small {private aircraft} may carry only a few people and have a propellor as the source of power. There are also {helicopters,} with overhead rotor blades which can take off and land vertically.
